{"id":1513913696,"question_id":3674,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"2 weeks, 4 days","timestamp":1737317784,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"32 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1513913696/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Count Non-Decreasing Subarrays After K Operations","memory":"143.1 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    long long countNonDecreasingSubarrays(vector<int>& nums, int k) {\n        reverse(nums.begin(), nums.end());\n        deque<int> dq;\n        int left = 0;\n        int right = 0;\n        long long reqOps = 0;\n        long long ret = 0;\n        int n = nums.size();\n        for( ; right<n; right++ ){\n            while( !dq.empty() && nums[right] > nums[dq.back()] ){\n                int curr = dq.back();\n                dq.pop_back();\n                int next = !dq.empty()? dq.back(): left-1;\n                reqOps += (long long) ( nums[right] - nums[curr] ) * (long long)(curr-next);\n            }\n            dq.push_back( right );\n            while( !dq.empty() && reqOps > (long long)k ){\n                reqOps -= (long long) ( nums[dq.front()] - nums[left] );\n                if( dq.front() == left )\n                    dq.pop_front();\n                left++;\n            }\n            ret += ( right - left + 1 );\n        }\n        return ret;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"count-non-decreasing-subarrays-after-k-operations","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
